com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.lexcialAnalyzer

Class LexicalAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.AbstractStage
      • com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.lexcialAnalyzer.LexicalAnalyzer

  • public class LexicalAnalyzer
extends AbstractStage
    This class is an implementation of the AbstractStage. It will lex a list of AbstractTokens with the help of the content from the ArkoiClass.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ArkoiClass arkoiClass
      This defines the ArkoiClass in which the LexicalAnalyzer got created.
      private LexicalErrorHandler errorHandler
      The LexicalErrorHandler is used for errors which are happening when lexing the input content.
      private int position
      The current position in the LexicalAnalyzer#content array.
      private AbstractToken[] tokens
      This AbstractToken[] is used to access the lexed AbstractTokens like in the SyntaxAnalyzer for methods like SyntaxAnalyzer.matchesNextToken(SymbolToken.SymbolType).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LexicalAnalyzer(ArkoiClass arkoiClass)
      Constructs a new LexicalAnalyzer with the given ArkoiClass to get the content or even the ArkoiCompiler.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char currentChar()
      Returns the current char and checks if the position went out of bounds.
      ErrorHandler errorHandler()
      Overwritten method from the AbstractStage class which will return the created LexicalErrorHandler.
      void next()
      This method will go to the next position and checks if it went out ouf bounds.
      void next(int positions)
      This method will skip the next specified positions from the current location (position.
      char peekChar(int offset)
      Differently to the next(int) method this method will just peek the next token with the specified offset and so it won't change the current position.
      boolean processStage()
      Overwritten method from the AbstractStage class which will run this stage.
      void undo()
      Returns to the last positions (subtracts one from the current position).

    • Field Detail

      • arkoiClass

        private final ArkoiClass arkoiClass
        This defines the ArkoiClass in which the LexicalAnalyzer got created.

      • errorHandler

        private final LexicalErrorHandler errorHandler
        The LexicalErrorHandler is used for errors which are happening when lexing the input content.

      • tokens

        private AbstractToken[] tokens
        This AbstractToken[] is used to access the lexed AbstractTokens like in the SyntaxAnalyzer for methods like SyntaxAnalyzer.matchesNextToken(SymbolToken.SymbolType).

      • position

        private int position
        The current position in the LexicalAnalyzer#content array. This position is used to peek and get tokens (e.g. next() or peekChar(int)).

    • Constructor Detail

      • LexicalAnalyzer

        public LexicalAnalyzer(ArkoiClass arkoiClass)
        Constructs a new LexicalAnalyzer with the given ArkoiClass to get the content or even the ArkoiCompiler.
        Parameters:
        arkoiClass - the ArkoiClass in which the LexicalAnalyzer gets constructed.

    • Method Detail

      • processStage

        public boolean processStage()
        Overwritten method from the AbstractStage class which will run this stage. The lexer will go through every position in the ArkoiClass.content array. It will skip newlines (and every other "whitespace" character e.g. 0x0c, 0x0a and 0x0d). Comments are getting lexed but they don't get added to the tokens list because they are irrelevant for the later process and are just used for the developers.
        Specified by:
        processStage in class AbstractStage
        Returns:
        false if an error occurred or true if everything worked correctly.

      • errorHandler

        public ErrorHandler errorHandler()
        Overwritten method from the AbstractStage class which will return the created LexicalErrorHandler.
        Specified by:
        errorHandler in class AbstractStage
        Returns:
        the LexicalErrorHandler which got created in the constructor.

      • next

        public void next(int positions)
        This method will skip the next specified positions from the current location (position. This method is helpful if you don't want to copy & paste next() x times until you got your result.
        Parameters:
        positions - the positions which are getting added to our current position position.

      • next

        public void next()
        This method will go to the next position and checks if it went out ouf bounds. If it did, it will set the current position position to the last possible position from the #content array.

      • peekChar

        public char peekChar(int offset)
        Differently to the next(int) method this method will just peek the next token with the specified offset and so it won't change the current position.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset which should get added to the current position position. Keep in mind, that it won't change the position and just returns the peeked token.
        Returns:
        the peeked token if it didn't went out of bounds. If it did, it will return the last possible char in the #content array.

      • currentChar

        public char currentChar()
        Returns the current char and checks if the position went out of bounds. If the current position went out of bounds, it will simply return the last possible char of the ArkoiClass.content array.
        Returns:
        the current token if it didn't went out of bounds. If it did, it will return the last possible char in the ArkoiClass.content array.

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Returns to the last positions (subtracts one from the current position). Also it will check if it went out of bounds (below 0) and will reset itself to 0 if it did.
